intro: Astragalus stenocystis, commonly known as the narrow-cysted milkvetch, is a flowering plant belonging to the legume family, Fabaceae. It is native to the arid and semi-arid regions of North America, particularly in the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. The plant is characterized by its spiny stems and small, pea-like flowers that bloom in shades of pink to purple. Its leaves are typically compound, consisting of several pairs of small, oval-shaped leaflets. Astragalus stenocystis is adapted to thrive in dry, well-drained soils and is often found in desert scrub and grassland habitats.
